intro: Bifaria gaudichaudii, commonly known as the white-flowered rock orchid, is a flowering plant native to New Caledonia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique, showy white flowers. The plant typically grows on rocky substrates and thrives in humid, tropical conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its roots are adapted to absorb nutrients from the rocky soil. Bifaria gaudichaudii is a rare and endangered species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts in its native habitat.
